<p><img src="http://media.tumblr.com/87dda5f22121633ebc5ff4dc817129a6/tumblr_inline_mxbbdyQq221rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p>**** <iframe frameborder="0" height="315" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/tw-0hDox6aA" width="420"></iframe></p>

<p><a href="http://www.youtube.com/user/Nassault630"><strong>Nassault</strong> </a>comes through with another cosmic masterpiece. Without further ado, we give you <em>Neil</em>.</p>
Nassault.... What to say.... Wow.... fantastic and thanks...
I'm subscribed to Nassault and regularly watch his videos. This was amazing, much like his other work, and it's really good to see it being showcased, because it is purely a beautiful piece of art
if nassault keeps this up, he's gonna dominate Wednesdays.
Each time he post video i watch if it's KSP

I don't know if there is a proper word for "Fernweh" in english. It's like homesick, but you hear the call of distant places. The word wanderlust is not strong enough.

This video causes Fernweh. I am free to roam where I want, but this movie makes me feel imprisoned and snared by day-to-day business. And yes, the video is indeed beautiful.

Thanks.
We know that there is at least one moment in all of history that will never be forgotten, not until the last human dies.

in the same topic you can watch this one

http://youtu.be/CbIZU8cQWXc
If only KSP had those fiery exhaust effects and ear-cracking sound effects...
Gotta give credit to the guy behind the scenes, Rareden and all the other VFX artists! Incredible job!
Wonderful work, brought a tear to my eye.

Yes, Nassault's videos are always a highlight in my youtube subscription updates.

I don't know if there is a proper word for "Fernweh" in english.

Funny thing is, according to google translator the English language borrows another German word here: wanderlust.

Other translators list: wanderlust; travel nerves; travel bug; itchy feet
